key.comment: The fully qualified host name
Comma separated list of name servers.
Comma separated search domains. Domains that will be tested together with a non FQDN host.

This a symbolic name for the device, and use to be identical to this key's parent directory name. This name is intended to be used in user interfaces. If this name is renamed, the parent directory key should be renamed too.
The Unix device name to be used with 'ifconfig' command
The fixed IP address of this interface.
If you're having problems with gated making 127.0.0.0/8 a martian, you can change this to something else (255.255.255.255, for example).
1 for automatic activation on boot, 0 for only manual

This a symbolic name for the device, and use to be identical to this key's parent directory name. This name is intended to be used in user interfaces. If this name is renamed, the parent directory key should be renamed too.
The device name as returned by its chipset
The UNIX device name.
The fixed IP address of this interface. Will be used only if bootproto key for this interface is not dhcp.
The MAC address of this network interface
The protocol type to be used to configure this interface. DHCP, BOOTP or static.
The hostname we'll tell to the DHCP server, for dynDNS purposes.
Weather this interface should be initialized with IPv6 too. Valid values are 0 or no and 1 or yes.
1 for automatic activation on boot, 0 for only manual
The phisical type of this network interface. Ethernet, Wireless, TokenRing, etc
1 to let regular users control this interface, 0 to be controled only by root
1 or yes means the DNS server will be provided by the remote peer.
Default gateway for the LAN connected to this interface.
